author: Special Correspondent
text:
The city police have arrested two persons in connection with the daylight robbery reported in Anna Nagar here on December 28 in which an aged couple was robbed of over 15 sovereigns of gold by three unidentified persons.

The police identified a duo as K. Balamurugan (33) of Parasurampatti and N. Ramar (37) of Thathaneri. The other accused, Manimaran, was absconding, the police said.

The third accused had engaged the arrested duo to strike at the house of S. Arockiasamy (72) in Thevar Colony around 3 p.m.

The trio barged into the house after overpowering the retired teacher. The accused threatened at knifepoint his wife, A. Bhuvaneswari (66), to part with her jewels. After assaulting them and locking them inside the house, the trio made good its escape with the valuables.

A special police team that followed the accused with a definite lead arrested Ramar and, based on his confession, the other.

The police said that the duo was accused in a murder case under Sellur police station limits in 2012. However, other details of how the robbers targeted the retired teachers would be known only after the arrest of the mastermind, the police said. The valuables had been recovered, the police said.
title: Anna Nagar robbery: two held
